title: Data-Defined Masks in 4D-STEM â€“ Not All Pixels Are Equal
content: Four-dimensional datasets, produced by the collection of a 2D scattering pattern at each point in the 2D raster in scanning transmission electron microscopy, contain a wealth of information. While it has been shown that for extremely thin specimens a direct quantum-mechanical interpretation is possible [1], and data processing using machine learning shows enormous promise [2], it remains the case for most practitioners that extracting useful spatial information from the 4D data remains a challenge.
